newsitem.title: USA: WMX to appeal decision; Q4 charge possible.
newsitem.headline: WMX to appeal decision; Q4 charge possible.

text.p: WMX Technologies Inc said Friday its Chemical Waste Management Inc subsidiary would appeal a decision of a federal court in Memphis, Tenn., which held that Chemical Waste owes about $91.5 million to former owners of a hazardous waste landfill.
WMX also said that, as a result of the decision, it could require a fourth quarter charge against earnings that would have a material adverse impact on results of its operations.

The court decision held that Chemical Waste owed about $91.5 million to the former owners of an Emelle, Ala., hazardous waste landfill in a commercial dispute involving a 1978 landfill purchase agreement.

"This is a case involving complex contractual issues," WMX said. "We are deeply disappointed with the court's decision and we strongly disagree with its findings. We will take the necessary steps to appeal the decision," the company said in a statement.
WMX provides waste management services, including storage and collection, processing and disposal. Shares of WMX closed at 34-5/8.
